Job Description Summary

As part of the Quantitative Investment Strategies team, the Quantitative Researcher will work closely with other members of the team to develop and test quantitative algorithms, develop analytical tools and models to enhance fundamentally driven investment and asset allocation decisions. This talented and experienced quantitative researcher will be responsible for conducting rigorous quantitative analysis utilizing advanced statistical techniques to test hypothesis, generate investment insights, and develop portfolio construction and asset allocation tools utilizing proprietary data sets for private equity investing. This role is ideal for an intellectually curious independent thinkers, who can creatively approach data analysis and clearly communicate complex ideas and insights.

Job Skills and Abilities
Graduate degree in a technical or quantitative field
Prior experience at a buy-side (equities) firm in a quantitative research or portfolio management role
Experience applying advanced quantitative techniques to solving highly complex data intensive problems
Creativity, modeling intuition, superior analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills
Demonstrated interest in or knowledge of investments, asset allocation, portfolio optimization, and cash flow modeling techniques
Proven ability to clearly and effectively communicate complex quantitative insights
Proficiency in at least one programming language, Python preferred
Results oriented. Innovative mind set. Comfortable taking initiative
Strives in a collegial and collaborative team-oriented environment.
Willingness to work in a position with uneven and high priority project work
Responsibilities

Quantitative Research: 80%
Applying rigorous scientific methods to develop sophisticated portfolio construction and asset allocation
Constructing data sets and applying quantitative techniques to generate investment insights
Conducting model backtesting a stress testing analysis
Contributing to investment thought leadership pieces
Collaborating and contributing to academic research papers
Advising on specific portfolio outcomes
Collaborating with Quantitative Developers to engineer automated tools to assist with portfolio optimization and asset allocation decisions
Responding to ad-hoc quantitative analysis requests: 20%
Supporting client facing teams in conducting ad-hoc analysis and responding to client requests
Education

Graduate degree in a technical field (Statistics/Mathematics/Physics/Computer Science)

Work Experience

3-5 years of experience in a quantitative role

You'll Help Fuel Our Growth
We're constantly asking questions to improve what we already do and explore new opportunities. Quantitative Trading Analysts are our front line for answering those questions to expand existing trading desks and develop new ones.

As a Quantitative Trading Analyst, you'll work directly with our traders and research infrastructure to:
Explore new datasets.
Develop pricing models.
Analyze trading strategy performance.
Assess risk.
Create tools to improve desk operations and efficiency.
You'll gain exposure to multiple trading desks, asset classes, data sets, and problem types in your first year to help both you and us find the best fit for your skills and interests. This role also offers flexibility for those who have or discover an interest in trading to transition to a Quantitative Trader role.

What You'll Need to Be Successful
Undergraduate degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, engineering or a related field.
Experience analyzing datasets or developing automation tools in Python or C++.
The ability to quantify your insights using probability and statistics.
Clear communication skills and the ability to work well both independently and in teams
A sense of urgency to solve meaningful problems and the ability to thrive in a competitive industry.

General Summary:

The position plays a critical role in the oversight of predictive analytics and robust modeling at Elevate. The Sr. Data Scientist, Model Governance provides effective challenge, review, oversight, guidance, and ongoing monitoring for all models used within our Account Origination (Fraud, Risk and Response) and Account Management functions.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Review models and provide effective challenge and feedback to the developers to action change.
Manage a model review/validation program aligned to OCC 2011-12 / SR 11-7 guidelines.
Perform model stability monitoring to ensure ongoing performance for business applications.
Deliver model variable stability and performance reviews on determined cadence.
Write clear and detailed model documentation coordinating efforts with the model developers.
Work with other members of the Governance team to ensure all documentation is saved in the official repository and meets internal Credit Policy standards for all new and existing models.
Utilize advanced statistical software to validate linear/non-linear, parametric/non-parametric based predictive modeling/data mining analytic methodologies.
Creation of associated decks for presentation to executive management.
Present findings and make recommendations to Model and Risk Governance teams.
Act as liaison between partner banks / third party validators and Elevate.
Complete all other projects as assigned.
Experience and Education:
Minimum M.S./M.A. in a highly quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or other quantitatively-oriented degree) or experience in a process related Senior Analyst role in an analytical capacity.
Strong quantitative /statistical modeling capabilities, including with 5+ years of experience in credit scoring and model development preferred.
3+ years’ experience in Risk Management or Model Governance functions including knowledge of OCC / FDIC regulations for model documentation.
3+ years’ experience within the consumer lending environment.
Strong SAS, R, and SQL skills preferred, with ability to conduct extensive data research required. Candidates with experience with other software such as Python, SPSS, MATLAB may also be considered.
Demonstrated experience working with large complex data sources.
Strong PowerPoint presentation skills a plus.
Required Skills and Abilities:
Ability to work in fast-paced environment with ever-changing demands.
Ability to manage multiple projects at one time, possibly including overseeing others projects.
Strong communication skills. Must be able to clearly communicate in speech and writing with Risk Management peers, Marketing, Operations, Collections, Finance, C-level Executives, CEO, and BOD.

Mindoula is a next-generation behavioral health management company that delivers tech-enabled, team-based 24/7/365 behavioral health support across the continuum of care. We are building the best population health management and analytics platform by using the latest technologies in big data and data science. Also, we are developing a comprehensive platform to address the needs of pre and post hospital care for large populations.

We are currently seeking to fill in multiple roles in technology and data to help build great technology helping Mindoula to grow faster.

We are looking for a talented data scientist who has a great passion for solving business problems by providing data insights through data modeling and analysis. You will work with senior leadership and data/technology teams to understand and solve complex business problems by developing data models and various techniques to analyze the health populations.

Responsibilities:
Derive insights from data analysis and modeling using multiple datasets, derived from the company platform, data provided by our customers etc.
Develop a comprehensive profile of the patient/member using the data available.
Apply statistical techniques to understand health data and analyze outcomes.
Apply data science algorithms and techniques to understand the member profile and prepare the data such that these insights help the care management team in addressing needs of our customers and members.
Be part of the data team, collaborate with product and engineering teams in developing the data required to support the functionality and new features of our platforms.
Must be self-driven and a quick learner.
Requires strong problem-solving, analytical and communication skills.
Healthcare data experience (claims, groupers) is a plus.
Technologies:
Data science: Analysis/Machine learning/AI algorithms and modeling.
Data Platforms: Spark, Python/Scala.
Strong SQL experience.
Databases: Postgres, Microsoft SQL Server
Hosting: Microsoft Azure
Tools: Github, CircleCI, CodeClimate
Requirements:
Minimum 3 years of experience in position
Healthcare experience with managing claims data
Compensation:
Competitive salary.
Generous benefits
This position is open to both as an employee or as a contractor/consultant.

Job Description:
Research Analyst

Rosemont, IL

Apply for this positionBack to Jobs

You have a passion for making an impact in the healthcare industry from an evidence-based standpoint and work well individually and on a team of like-minded researchers. Your knowledge and interests are in qualitative and quantitative research methods. You are detail-oriented, focused, and enjoy reading and evaluating clinical research articles.

If this sounds like you, read on!

The Research Analyst participates in the development of clinical practice guidelines, systematic literature reviews, performance measures, technology overviews, and appropriate use criteria by critically evaluating published studies, abstracting information from these studies, using applicable statistical methods to analyze the evidence from those studies, and preparing written commentaries and clinical scenarios for use by physician work groups/panels. Produces professional reports for publication of AAOS Appropriate Use Criteria, performance measures, systematic literature reviews, technology overviews, and Clinical Practice Guidelines.

Critically evaluates the quality, conduct, and analysis of published clinical research studies.

Abstracts information/data from peer-reviewed clinical research studies to create literature reviews for the development of AAOS Appropriate Use Criteria, Performance Measures, Systematic Literature Reviews, Technology Overviews and Guidelines.

Demonstrates ability to communicate the strength and weaknesses of clinical studies and interpret meta-analyses and statistical analyses.

Provides technical and administrative support at AAOS Appropriate Use Criteria, Performance Measure, Systematic Literature Review, Technology Overviews and Guidelines work group meetings/ conference calls. Responds to the feedback of the work group members responsible for developing appropriate use criteria and guidelines; corrects errors noted in data abstraction.

Maintains current knowledge of appropriateness and quantitative methods including review of current peer-reviewed literature and achieving publication in peer-reviewed literature. Additionally, maintains knowledge of musculoskeletal and other clinical medicine research.

Required Qualifications:
Master’s degree in the health or life sciences with relevant experience including statistical analysis software or survey research experience.
Familiarity with the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly with Word, Access and Excel.
Demonstrated ability to understand and critically evaluate the design, conduct, and analysis of clinical studies.
Demonstrated ability to comprehend articles published in peer-reviewed medical journals.
Strong oral and written communication abilities.
Strong analytical and organizational skills.
Desired Qualifications:
At least one year of previous experience in preparing, systematic literature reviews.
Experienced in the use of STATA, SPSS, or SAS statistical software packages
Familiarity with evidence-based medicine processes, RAND/UCLA Appropriateness Method or other Delphi methods.
Familiarity with survey research methods and analysis.
If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following:

-Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.

-Attach your resume, cover letter and any additional materials that support your application.

JOB CODE: HR/RA20

ACME BRICK COMPANY*
“Join the Acme Brick Family”*
BI-LINGUAL PARALEGAL/RISK ANALYST*
FLSA Status: Non-exempt*
Acme Brick Company (a Berkshire Hathaway Company) is an organization of professionals in the building materials industry. Acme manufacture brick and block products and distributes its own products as well as brick and other building materials manufactured by others. We operate in 13 states with a philosophy that we are much more than a brick manufacturer and distributor.
Summary*
We are currently seeking an individual for the Paralegal/Risk Analyst position to join our Legal and the Risk Management Department. This individual will play an essential role in the handling of a wide variety of the legal, risk management and insurance needs of the company. This individual must have excellent legal, administrative, communication, writing and organizational skills and experience. The ideal candidate has a personable disposition, mindfulness of confidentiality, strong work ethic, and natural ability to roll with the punches, being flexible to handle anything that might come their way. Also, this individual must be a strong and reliable support to overall company operations, legal and corporate procedures and customer service, internal and external. The efforts of this position are an integral part of the organizational efficiency and a congenial work environment of the Department and with our company’s associates, vendors and customers.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities (other duties may be assigned)*
Support of attorneys in legal work performed for the company, _e.g.,_ litigation and claims (discovery and pleadings) contract drafting and review, contract disputes, employment and labor matters, real estate, corporate compliance and documentation, mergers and acquisitions, intellectual property, warranty and product claims, _etc_.
Support of insurance and bond related matters for the Company, _e.g.,_ acquisition and renewal of all lines of insurance and various bonds, dealing with insurance carriers and brokers, preparing reports for executive management, review and payment of invoices and premiums, managing certificates of insurance (Company’s and vendors’), notary public services and obtaining commission bonds, _etc._
Support of risk management matters for the Company, _e.g.,_ documentation and filing of claims, providing support and tracking of claims, risk and claims reporting to executive management, policy review and compliance_, etc_.
Manage legal, risk management, insurance and other related Department files and documents (electronic & paper), _e.g.,_ intake, create, organize, file, track status, record keeping, maintain, close, _etc._
Prepare and maintain corporate books, reports, records and documents and necessary legal filings and research of local, state and federal records and compliance, which are assigned to the Legal Department.
Contract management and assisting attorneys in drafting and review of various Company contracts, _e.g.,_ insurance, merger/acquisition, customer and distributor sales, employment, vendor, equipment, service, contractor, real estate, leases, _etc._
Litigation, pre-suit claims and third party discovery support for legal department and outside legal counsel.
Review, confirm and arrange for payment of invoices and charges arising from Legal, Risk and Insurance matters.
Assist in preparation of legal, risk management and insurance budgets and allocations.
Assist and perform Claims Coordinator and Risk Management Assistant duties and responsibilities when unavailable.
Administrative and secretarial support for attorneys in the Department:
Prepare and send correspondence as needed for legal and risk management matters;
Create and edit various documents, reports, and other materials, etc.;
Copying, scanning, faxing, emailing and mailing documents and correspondence;
Coordinate travel arrangements for the Legal and Risk Management personnel;
Manage purchasing cards and expense reports for Department;
Review, confirm & arrange for payment of invoices and charges for Legal, Risk and Insurance matters; and
Maintain and coordinate department calendars.
Other legal or corporate duties or activities as needed by the Company, as directed by General Counsel.
Skills and Experience Required for Success*
Paralegal training with five (5) or more years of experience in actual practice for a law firm or corporate legal department, preferably both.
Licensed by a state bar or other licensing authority as a paralegal/legal assistant, preferably the State of Texas.
Obtain and/or maintain a notary public certification from the state of Texas, Commissioned and Online.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (some Spanish would be a bonus).
Excellent drafting, editing and proofing experience and skills, particularly in the use of proper formal business and legal writing, formatting and citations.
Adept in the use and capabilities of Microsoft Office, Excel, and Outlook.
Working knowledge & experience with contract management & ERP software (JD Edwards ERP experience preferred).
Handling of litigation pleadings, docketing, motions and discovery.
Compliance and documentation of corporate entities.
Bi-Lingual (English/Spanish)
Competencies Required for Success*
Integrity
Strict Confidentiality
Organization (personal & departmental)
Manages Stress and Stressful Situations
Attention to Detail
Initiative
Teamwork
Customer Service Orientation
Relationship Building
Quality Focused
Education*
High school diploma or equivalent required.
Paralegal degree or certification from an accredited school required (but a pertinent bachelor’s degree with significant germane paralegal experience demonstrated may be experienced).
College degree (Bachelors or Associates) or pertinent hours are preferred.

Job Description: SAS Programmer/Analyst Mid-Level
Department: Data Analytics Group
Supervision: Division Director
Salary: For Internal use only
About Econometrica, Inc.
We are researchers and experts helping our clients make informed decisions using advanced analytics. We tackle challenges with innovative methods, research tools and strategy to improve the quality of life. Whether examining policies to provide the best patient care, rebuilding housing communities, or analyzing the merits of space exploration, we apply hard work and dedication to each of our projects
The Opportunity
This is a great opportunity for someone who loves to learn and wants to work in a dynamic enviroment! As a team member you be formulating and developing innovative approaches to solve our clients’ most challenging business, technology and system integration problems. The candidate will be involved in all aspects of data analysis and quality. He/she will analyze data collection plans and coordinate various data systems, implement data collection, processing, and analysis tactics, and provide consultation on design of data processing systems, which includes specifying needed output, required input and the methods of validation and quality control. This candidate will successfully collaborate with health experts, researchers and project stake holders.
This position will:
• Identify data quality issues and develop recommendation on how to resolve those issues to ensure data completeness, consistency and accuracy for the clients’ analytical products.
• Apply knowledge in natural language processing to create innovative solutions to our clients’ most challenging business and technology problems.
• Collaborate closely with epidemiologists and clinical investigators to determine study design and formulate analysis plans. Consult with non-technical audiences to develop high quality client deliverables as well as effectively communicate the results to stakeholders.
• Create and maintain documentation for generated work products.
• Design and implement validation tests for analytical products created by research staff. Provide SAS programming and troubleshooting support when needed.
• Provide project support including serving as a team member on project assignments
Education & Qualifications
Desired Skills and Experience:
• 5+ years of experience using SAS, including base SAS, to conduct advanced statistical analyses.
• Experience with using a scripting language, such as Python or R a plus, and using a UNIX based system
• Experience in using Business Intelligence (BI) and visualization tools, such as Tableau a plus
• Base SAS Certification.
• Developing effective relationships with clients, consultants and contractors
• Participate in customer and departmental meetings
• Experience with manipulating large complex databases to track and evaluate patterns related to healthcare or other business processes.
• Experience with working on projects in a consulting environment.
• Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team setting.
• Strong oral and written communication skills.
• Ability to obtain a security clearance
Additional requirements of the position could involve occasional travel relevant to the responsibilities noted above.
Education
• Minimum Bachelor’s degree in in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics or similar quantitative field. Master’s degree a plus
• Experience in developing visual dashboards
Our Generous Benefits Package Includes:
• Being a part of a dynamic research group, which continues to grow.
• Discount health club membership.
• Company-sponsored health care plan and optional vision/dental coverage.
• Excellent training and development opportunities.
• Discount garage parking.
• Referral bonuses.
• 401(k) Program.
• Discount rental car service.
• Organized social activities.
• Metro Smart Benefits® Program.

The Challenge


We work with thousands of partners, hundreds of thousands of paying customers, millions of resumes, and billions of data points. We're profitable and have scaled fast on our current architecture, but need someone smart to read between the lines and use data to take us to 10x and beyond.

The Role


We have a rapidly growing cloud-based infrastructure, and you'll work closely and liaise with all departments: Engineering, Marketing, Business Development, Ops, and Finance, and most importantly, Product. You'll be a part of the Product team because we want you to help dictate what and how we should be building. It'll be a critical role on a critical team. We're looking for someone who thrives on looking at multiple disparate sets of data and diving in to tell us something we don't know. You should want to tell us what would help the business, and spec out resources and requirements to do so. You will be encouraged to "hack" a lot of one-off reports and visualizations. We expect a great candidate to have a lot of upward mobility in our burgeoning business intelligence unit.

Skills & Requirements
You have a passionate relationship with big data and/or data mining.
You have data manipulation skills and the ability to navigate relational databases via SQL, NoSQL architectures, and flat log files alike.
You have expert knowledge of data presentation and visualization and experience in one or more of Excel, Tableau, Periscope Data, Looker, D3, Highcharts, or other data viz platforms.
Your "tool of choice" is actually a hybrid of tools, anything from R to command line scripting to something analog and offline. You're interested in what have data achieves.
You're authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.
You, If We're Lucky
You have an advanced degree in a quantitative field.
You're conflicted about wanting to be a Product Manager or a Data Engineer.
You have exposure to scripting or MVC languages in a team environment.
Were a team full of tech polyglots and that excites you instead of terrifying you.
You've scaled something weird and strange before.
You've had quant and data analysts as direct reports.
You have a great one-week-of-work-saved-my-company-millions story.
You have startup experience!
What Makes Us Different
We operate with the agility of a startup, but have the stability of a well-established organization
We value work-life balance
We offer competitive pay + options
Employees can pick the computer setup of their choosing. Whatever helps you work better, it's yours

PCG is searching for proven Data Analysts to define data requirements and functional specifications that will drive improved environment and analysis that align to business objectives.

About Centria Healthcare:

Founded in 2009 and headquartered in Farmington Hills, Michigan, Centria Healthcare is a leading provider of home-based catastrophic injury and rehabilitation care, private duty nursing, and supportive living services. Centria Healthcare Autism Services is the largest provider of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) across the state of Michigan, with services in other states.

Position Overview:

We are looking for an ambitious, talented and high potential Recruiting Operations Analyst to join our team to support our growth strategy by providing data and analytical insights to the Talent Acquisition, Human Resources and Leadership teams. You will have the opportunity to partner closely with the Talent Acquisition and HR teams in building structure, reporting, processes, and utilizing data to inform our decisions as we scale. This role will have exposure to members of our Executive Leadership team. In current state, you will report directly to the Director of Talent Acquisition and will work closely with the Sr. Manager of Clinical Talent Acquisition as well as other Human Resources Leaders, this role will ultimately report to the Vice President of Talent Acquisition, once identified.

Responsibilities:

The ideal candidate must be able to perform the following essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodations.
Drive progress against key milestones and project/program objectives, inclusive of leading any necessary change management efforts
Respond to questions, queries, and concerns/issues while working collaboratively with various Talent Acquisition and Human Resources leaders, internal stakeholders, and vendor representatives to resolve in a timely and confidential manner
Optimize the team's workflow, processes, documentation, and data management practices
Develop recommendations for standardized metrics and reporting to share across organizations and Leadership
Track and report on all relevant activities including creating/managing against key performance indicators and automate reporting wherever possible
Build and maintain effective cross-functional relationships in support of a variety of HR initiatives
Optimize ATS and supports recruiters in formalizing and tracking all aspects of the recruiting process: from sourcing, prospecting, interviewing, and closing
Support TA Leaders in the execution and management of the recruitment operations strategy to deliver an exceptional candidate experience
Partner with Talent Acquisition, Human Resources, and hiring managers to understand and improve operational functions, analyze results, and build best practices to support initiatives - DE&I, compensation, onboarding etc.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports and other data sets that help derive actionable insights for overall efficiency and recruiting focus
Assist in the management, implementation, and off-boarding of recruiting tools and programs Greenhouse, Greyscale, LinkedIn Recruiter, etc.
Project manage discrete elements of our TA/HR programs inclusive of ensuring stakeholder and vendor engagement and alignment
Work alongside Marketing to best utilize our digital campaigns relative to share across our employer branding channels and drive additional candidate interest/flow
Required Skills, Qualifications, and Knowledge:
BA/BS degree required; Master's degree preferred
Power BI experience required
3 years relevant analyst work experience, including corporate HR experience or business consulting
Demonstrated project management skills in service of strategic initiatives
Strong creative problem-solving abilities
Exceptional attention to detail, communication and relationship-building skills as well as the ability to prioritize and juggle multiple demands
Ability to analyze data, understand trends, develop recommendations for action based on quantitative and qualitative analysis
Self-starter who proactively identifies opportunities to streamline processes with a high level of creativity, perseverance and flexibility
Comfort with a dynamic environment and navigating ambiguity
Experience working with an ATS (we use Greenhouse)
Creative, proactive thinker who actively seeks solutions and process improvements
Data-driven with demonstrated experience building and maintaining reports
Centria's office hours are Monday through Friday from 8:30am-6:00pm. Additional time may be required to complete above work or meet company objectives.

Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, physical requirements such as bending, reaching and lifting of up to 50 pounds may be required. This role will require sitting a majority of the day as well as walking as standing when needed. This role will require close visual activity on multiple computer screens or monitors and the ability to analyze data and figures on a screen.

Dominion National, a rapidly growing and leading provider of dental and vision benefits has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Analyst of Corporate Performance in our Arlington,VA office.

The Senior Analyst of Corporate Performance is responsible for translating stakeholder data requirements into reporting deliverables. Work involves developing reporting solutions and controls to improve the accuracy and efficiency of external reporting, performing quantitative and qualitative analysis of operational data to evaluate key performance metrics, track trends and identify discrepancies in data and reporting as well working collaboratively to develop effective reporting solutions for the organization.

Essential functions include but are not limited to:

Performs a quality review of all external report generated prior to internal and external distribution. Ensures adherence to all reporting procedures and guidelines are completed accurately and timely.
Review and provide quality assurance feedback to reporting entities to ensure consistent and accurate operational reporting.
Effectively develops and maintain all reporting procedures ensuring the accurate tracking of key metrics and trend reporting.
Establish, document and maintain change control management procedures for the performance provided to external entities.
Develop reporting solutions and controls to improve the accuracy and efficiency our external reporting.
Collaborates with functional leadership throughout the organization in the preparation and presentation of client reporting.
Acts as the primary point of contact for Dominion National for the purposes of both internal and external audits.
Meet ad hoc reporting needs of the VP of Operations and the President as requested.
Performs other duties as assigned.

The minimum qualifications for the ideal candidate include:

High School diploma required. Bachelor’s degree preferred from an accredited university. A combination of equivalent years of related work experience and education will be considered.
3-5 years of progressive experience with system databases, report writing, data analysis is required. Experience with modeling, and visualization processes is preferred.
Must have strong analytical skills and an understanding of system databases, data elements, and application software solutions to maximize data gathering and data analysis.
Requires an understanding of programming logic. Advanced SQL (across multiple platforms) skills are required. Some exposure to SAS and Power BI strongly preferred.
Adept at maintaining databases, queries, and report writing to interpret data utilizing reporting packages (Business Objects, SSRS, etc.), databases (SQL, Access, etc.), programming (XML), file formats (CSV, Flat file)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, Access, etc.) is required.
Must have the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of a variety of analytical concepts and techniques such as cost-benefit analysis, statistical analysis, forecasting is required.
Strong attention to detail and problem resolution is required.
Must have high-level organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize as needed in a changing work environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact well with both internal and external clients is required.
Strong presentation skills and ability to work collaboratively with Senior Leadership in the daily performance of their duties is required.

Job Description

Metro is seeking to fill an Operations Research Analyst position on the Bus Priority team within the Office of Business Transformation. Metro’s Bus Priority team is dedicated to advancing programs that improve the operating performance and value to our customers of Metro’s bus services.

The Operations Research Analyst, Bus Priority, is responsible for conducting primary and secondary research, structuring and executing data analytics, designing practical solutions to improve bus schedule reliability and run-time performance, managing multiple high priority assignments, and collaborating with bus operating and planning staff across the organization. The successful candidate will need a combination of strong communication, organizational, and analytic skills. The ideal candidate will also bring experience in transportation or transit planning. Desired Skills: Analytical skills (e.g., GIS, Excel, Tableau, Python, R, or VBA) and communication skills (e.g., policy memos and decision-focused presentations).

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Business Administration or related field

Experience

Minimum of four (4) years of work experience (including internships) performing Data Science, Statistical or Industrial Engineering related work activities

Certification/Licensure

N/A

Preferred

Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification or equivalent
Master’s Degree in Statistics, Business Administration or related field

Medical Group

Satisfactorily complete the medical examination for this position, if required. The incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of this position either with or without reasonable accommodations.

Summary

As a member of the Executive Vice President of Strategy, Planning and Program Management, Strategic Initiatives Group, this position works on key strategic projects that seek to secure long-term improvements across all WMATA departments. The position involves research, analysis, solution design, implementation and evaluation of process improvement projects in support of operational departments. The Senior Operations Analyst position is required to build relationships at all levels of the Authority to secure lasting improvements in the way the Authority operates.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Gathers a broad range of quantitative and qualitative data using data collection methods suitable for the specific business environment, including surveys, workshops, interviews, and task analysis in order to build a deep understanding of business problems
Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify the root causes of a variety of business problems
Converts findings from analyses into actionable recommendations and implementable solutions
Produces a high volume of high-quality documents to support the design, communication and implementation of findings and recommendations, including but not limited to business process maps, slide presentations, dashboards, policies and procedures
Leads the execution of tasks and deliverables across projects to convert evidence-based research findings and recommendations into implemented solutions that are beneficial to the organization. This includes but is not limited to research, analysis, stakeholder engagement, implementation, change management, evaluation and monitoring
Builds and manages relationships with a broad range of stakeholders and partners at all levels of the organization, enabling deep understanding of business problems and implementation of lasting solutions.
The essential duties listed are not intended to limit specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Nor is it intended to limit in any way the right of managers and supervisors to assign, direct and control the work of employees under their supervision.

Evaluation Criteria

Consideration will be given to applicants whose resumes demonstrate the required education and experience. Applicants should include all relevant education and work experience.

Evaluation criteria may include one or more of the following:

Skills and/or behavioral assessment
Personal interview
Verification of education and experience (including certifications and licenses)
Criminal Background Check (a criminal conviction is not an automatic bar to employment)
Medical examination including a drug and alcohol screening (for safety sensitive positions)
Review of a current motor vehicle report

Closing

WMATA is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by applicable federal law.

Responsibilities
**This is an anticipated vacancy***
The Senior Compensation Analyst is responsible for planning, developing, implementing, and administering base and variable compensation programs, including related policies and procedures, in order to be responsive to the State Board of Administration’s (SBA) strategic goals and priorities. The position is also responsible for assuring that compensation programs are consistently administered in compliance with SBA policies and procedures and federal and state laws and regulations. The Senior Compensation Analyst reports to the Senior Operating Officer-Human Resources (SOO-HR).

20% - Collaborates with SBA leaders in the development of job documentation/position descriptions, performs job evaluations for the SBA’s base pay program and advises the SOO-HR on classification/reclassification of positions and base pay requests and recommendations

Advises senior leaders and managers on developing position descriptions to ensure accurate job responsibilities/essential functions and job requirements, and assures position descriptions are consistent with industry standards, laws, and regulations
Reviews, in collaboration with senior leaders and/or managers, requests for classification/reclassification and recommends job titles, pay grades and base pay
Receives new hire salary requests from the Recruiter, assesses internal equity and external competitiveness, and recommends new hire salary recommendations to the SOO-HR
Processes Personnel Action Forms for approval and updates human resources information system to reflect approved changes

15% - Facilitates annual base pay increase processes

Receives approval from the SOO-HR, Chief Operating/Financial Officer (CO/FO) and Executive Director & Chief Investment Officer (ED & CIO) for the allocation of base pay rate pools for each department/business unit, and communicates base pay rate amounts to senior leaders
Collects recommended base pay adjustments from senior leaders and analyzes recommended increases against colleagues’ performance and discusses discrepancies with SOO-HR and senior leaders
Aggregates recommended increases, analyzes data to determine financial impact and communicates findings to the SOO-HR, CO/FO, and Deputy Executive Director (DED)
Receives final approval from the ED & CIO on base pay adjustments and processes approved changes
Provides written memoranda to senior leaders to communicate approved base pay adjustments to SBA colleagues
Analyzes market data to recommend salary adjustment for the ED & CIO, and collaborates with SOO-HR, CO/FO, DED and external consultant to develop a final recommended salary adjustment

15% - Participates in and conducts compensation surveys and recommends updates to maintain a market-based base pay structure

Participates in relevant compensation surveys and collaborates with survey vendors and/or compensation consultants to review and finalize survey data
Collects published market data and conducts ad hoc surveys to analyze market pay levels and rates
Recommends base pay structure revisions and/or new structures to maintain external competitiveness and internal equity, and ensures cost effectiveness and consistency with compensation trends and organization objectives
Coordinates approval of base pay structure revisions and/or new structures, and updates human resources information system to reflect approved changes

20% - Tracks and calculates incentive compensation payouts

Tracks the quarterly incentive compensation program eligibility list and meets with new participants and/or current participants with personnel action changes to discuss eligibility
Collects individual performance scores, reviews scores against colleagues’ performance and advises SOO-HR of any inconsistencies
Facilitates process for the individual performance scores for the ED & CIO with the Compensation Subcommittee of the Investment Advisory Council and the SBA’s external compensation consultant
Calculates incentive compensation payouts quarterly and annually and tracks deferred awards and balances and ensures compliance with SBA policies
Submits incentive compensation calculations to external consultant for review and validation
Ensures all approvals and recalculations are completed in a timely manner and provides incentive compensation payout memorandum to senior leaders
Ensures incentive compensation checks are signed for and picked up by the incentive compensation program participant

15% - Develops, proposes and tracks budget for incentive compensation and fixed pay programs

Tracks personnel actions and rate expenditures for base pay, leave payouts, bonus/cash awards, on-call pay and overtime to ensure sufficient budget for the SBA, Florida Prepaid College Programs and the Division of Bond Finance each month
Sends out department rate expenditures to each senior leader of the SBA, Florida Prepaid College Programs and the Division of Bond Finance
Requests rate transfers with the Budget Manager to ensure rate budgets meet the needs of the SBA, and advises the Florida Prepaid College Programs and the Division of Bond Finance on rate transfer needs
Proposes annual budget for base pay, nonrecurring compensation, leave payments and employee moving expenses for the SBA

10% - Provides administrative and analytical support to the SOO-HR and human resources colleagues

Works with Human Resources and Information Technology colleagues to ensure the human resources information system meets compensation needs and is updated to reflect personnel changes
Evaluates and recommends changes to SBA compensation policies, guidelines and philosophy
Develops and sustains knowledge of federal, state and local compensation and human resources laws and regulations in order to ensure program compliance, and remains abreast of industry trends
Attends Investment Advisory Council Compensation Subcommittee meetings as needed to inform leadership and subcommittee members of the progress of the SBA’s compensation programs
Develops ad hoc reports and conducts analysis as requested
Assists other functional areas of human resources

05% - Performs other duties as assigned

Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in business, human resources, finance, accounting, or a related field and three years of related experience. Or any combination of education and/or experience equal to the minimum requirements.

Preferred Qualifications:

Master of Business Administration or master’s degree from an accredited college or university in human resources, finance, accounting, or a related field
Certified Compensation Professional (CCP), SHRM-Certified Professional (SHRM-CP), SHRM-Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP), Professional in Human Resources (PHR), or Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR) credential
Experience designing, implementing and maintaining variable pay programs

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Advanced knowledge of quantitative and qualitative principles and practices of compensation, including job analysis, documentation and evaluation, and market pricing
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word and PowerPoint Working knowledge of human resource information systems (preferably PeopleSoft) including database design, structure, functions and processes
Knowledge of applicable regulatory environment for human resources including federal, state and local regulations, laws and statutes
Skill in participating in and designing compensation surveys and interpreting survey results
Skill in managing projects, including planning, organizing, and prioritizing work assignments by following broad and complex instructions
Highly effective organizational and interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional research, analytical, evaluation, critical-thinking and negotiation skills
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Ability to use good judgement and discretion when working with confidential matters, materials and situations
Strong business acumen with a willingness to learn and maintain working knowledge of the investment management industry and related operational functions

Hiring Range: $66,600 - $83,300

Sr. Data Scientist

Date:

Sep 18, 2020

Location:

Danvers, MA, US

#job-location.job-location-inline {
display: inline;
}

Abiomed is a pioneer and global leader in healthcare technology and innovation, with a mission of Recovering Hearts & Saving Lives. With corporate headquarters in Danvers, Massachusetts, offices in Aachen & Berlin, Germany and Tokyo, Japan, Abiomed’s 1,400 employees form one of the fastest growing medical device companies in the world. We attract and retain exceptional talent with our collaborative culture, passion for our work, and a strong commitment to employee professional development.

Patients First | Innovation | Winning Culture | Heart Recovery

The Abiomed Applied Research group is a team of scientists and engineers building a new generation of Impella “Smart Pump” devices. We are currently hiring a Data Scientist to contribute to the design and implementation of advanced analytics and innovative machine learning algorithms that guide treatment decisions and improve patient outcomes. These algorithms will play a central role in the pursuit of Abiomed’s mission of recovering hearts and saving lives. We are looking for a creative self-starter who thrives in a continuously-growing data environment and enjoys a fast-paced, dynamic research group. If this sounds like you, please read on:

Responsibilities
Responsible for end-to-end development of analytics queries and machine learning algorithms
Design new statistical and physiological features for time-series data
Evaluate algorithm performance in offline (in silico) and live (in vitro, in vivo) environments
Collaborate with software teams to implement algorithms in cloud or on embedded hardware
Maintain concise descriptions of algorithm design specifications and performance evaluations
Perform variability analyses for model optimization

Multi-Asset Quantitative Developer – Job Description

PRIMARY PURPOSE

Quantitative Developers in the Multi-Asset Division collaborate with investment professionals at all stages of development, solving complex challenges in coding, algorithm design, and numerical computation. They assist investment research and model development, prototype portfolio management applications, and support the transition of research and investment analysis to production processes.

We seek an individual with relevant experience in both financial services and technology, someone who can operate independently as well as collaboratively with investment staff to: develop custom analyses and applications in a proof-of-concept environment; refactor proof-of-concept code; prototype pre-production solutions; provide input into application supportability and ongoing quality control; serve as intermediary between investment professionals and core IT; and pivot between research-oriented prototyping and production-oriented collaboration with the IT team.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Collaborate with investment staff to create and maintain prototypes of research models and portfolio management applications, facilitating research-driven investment activity and enabling further research. Create working interim solutions, starting with a minimum viable solution and iteratively refining until a satisfactory solution is achieved.

•Deeply understand the goals and business context of ongoing research and investment strategies under development.

•Identify and evaluate the most appropriate methods, tools, and datasets to address each issue.

•Develop computational methods for solving problems that occur in areas of science and engineering or that come from applications in business or industry.

•Apply mathematical theories and techniques to the solution of practical problems in business, engineering, the sciences, or other fields.

•Develop mathematical or statistical models of phenomena to be used for analysis or for computational simulation.

•Assemble sets of assumptions and explore the consequences of each set.

•Perform computations and apply methods of numerical analysis to data.

•Develop code libraries and solutions that leverage and appropriately augment existing structures to meet the needs of the research-driven investment and analysis processes (including analyses requested by or directed to clients and prospects), often in the absence of clearly documented specifications.

•Guide analysts and other Multi Asset associates in current technology best practices and advise or teach better programming techniques where needed and appropriate

•Consult with core developers (IT) to identify which interim solutions (e.g., tools, applications, reports, data structures, etc.) have matured sufficiently to transition to a production environment, and produce specifications for such solutions, enabling IT to elevate strategically targeted prototypes to production.

•Maintain knowledge in the field by reading professional journals, talking with other researchers, and attending professional conferences.

REQUIREMENTS:

•Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics); strong academic credentials

•Established track record (5+ years) developing software and applications, including experience in quantitative/modeling environments (e.g. Matlab, Splus, R, Python) and SQL databases

•Practical understanding of Computer Science fundamentals and all layers of modern application design

•Demonstrated ability to learn and work in new computing environments and languages

•Ability to pivot between prototyping, refactoring, and production-ready development styles, ideally demonstrated by prior experience

•Evidence of ability to independently deliver results and self-direction, along with strong initiative

•Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; willingness to learn new approaches to problem-solving

•Familiarity with financial markets across asset classes, supported by coursework and experience

•Demonstrated interest in understanding the broader business context within which a technology solution is needed (focus on the problem, not the code)

•Experience working with large, complex data sets

•Ability to modulate oral and written communications to different levels of technical capability

•Comfort with ambiguity in problem specification and still-emerging objectives; ability and willingness to adjust to mid-stream changes in objectives or process

•High level of pragmatism; able to apply varying levels of rigor appropriately to different projects based on the nature of the project and surrounding circumstances

•Ability to multi-task and to simultaneously push forward several projects

PREFERRED:

•Possession of or commitment to obtaining CFA charter

•Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics)

•Background in statistics or data science

•Experience designing and working with web service architectures

•Experience designing web frontends and/or modern web frameworks and visualization packages

•Experience leading projects involving teams featuring a heterogenous mix of skill sets

•Experience navigating and bridging gaps in context or understanding that arise between Investment and Technology components of an organization

•Experience leading a small or medium-sized team consisting of other developers or equivalents

Operations Monitoring Analyst Consultant

Background of this search: The Office of Strategic Planning and Development Effectiveness (SPD) is charged with providing technical guidance in order to develop a culture of results within the Bank, and to help the Bank innovate its core business and ensure the effectiveness and efficiency of its products and methods over time.

The team’s mission: As part of SPD, the Strategic Planning and Monitoring Division (SPD/SMO) is responsible, among others, for administer the monitoring system that captures project performance, the Progress Monitoring Report (PMR). On average, the Bank has around 650 Sovereign Guarantee Operations, all of which need to report on progress of the commitments agreed in a results matrix, through the monitoring systems and within the Convergence Platform. The SPD/SMO team that works in the monitoring tools provides guidance and support to Vice-Presidencies of Sectors and Countries (VPS & VPC) teams to comply with the requirements to report on progress as well as ensure quality of information

.

Provide technical and analytical support in core corporate and operational matters, especially on Bank’s monitoring instruments. The candidate should have demonstrated capability in managing complex and diverse processes that require input and coordination with multiple stakeholders.

What you’ll do:

The selected candidate will perform the following activities:
Project Monitoring
Contribute to the development of new or revised tools, methodologies, procedures, and policies that allows for better implementation and monitoring of the Bank's portfolio.
Support the preparation and implementation of the Progress Monitoring Report.
Monitor and promote the consistent application of tools, methodologies, procedures, policies and best practice in project execution and evaluation.
Provide input to content questions related to monitoring that may arise from the users in the process. Maintain client focus and contribute to identifying issues related to the functions of the system and appropriate solutions.
Contribute to identify and communicate good practices and common errors in system and content use.
Participate in as well as summarizing the conclusions of portfolio reviews, seminars or workshops related to the monitoring process.
Data Analytics and Reporting
Collect data from multiple sources by building/updating queries in SQL and/or Access. Processing data with Excel or statistical packages such as Stata or R being able to report on monitoring issues, including performance classification benchmarks and indicators, qualitative information and corporate results contributions.
Contribute with other Bank units to obtain and review documents and provide written comments to proposals related to the Bank’s commitments (GCI-9), and provide technical analysis and input as part of SPD’s contribution.
System Testing and Enhancement
Contribute to the analysis of improvements to the monitoring system and their implementation;
Provide technical guidance to users and the help desk in answering questions on the methodologies and business rules of the monitoring systems.
Others
Provide Support in other areas that could be required.

What you’ll need:

Citizenship: You are a citizen of one of our 48-member countries. We may offer assistance with relocation and visa applications for you and your eligible dependents.

Consanguinity: You have no family members (up to fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB Group.

Education : Master’s degree Economics, Public Policy, Information technology or related fields.

Experience: Minimum experience of 5 years on relevant professional and academic experience in Economics, Public Policy, Information technology or related fields.
Areas of Expertise: Knowledge on: i) program logic and results matrix approach and Earned Value Analysis; ii) database management (Stata, SQL Server and Excel proficiency level required. MS Access and R is strongly desirable; and iii) Microsoft Office products.
Skills:
Ability to consolidate, summarize and critically analyze qualitative and quantitative information to compose concise and strategically relevant conclusions to be used for a variety of internal and external purposes.
Ability to diagnose problems and propose reliable solution as well as develop, analyze, and articulate project issues.
Capability in managing complex and diverse processes that require input and coordination with multiple stakeholders.
Ability to extract data from multiple sources, cross-compare them and check validity.
Languages: Proficiency in at least two of the Bank’s official languages (one being English or Spanish).

Our culture: Our people are committed and passionate about improving lives in Latin-America and the Caribbean, and they get to do what they love in a diverse, collaborative and stimulating work environment. Because we are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment, we embrace all diversity and encourage women, LGBTQ , persons with disabilities, afro-descendants, and indigenous people to apply.

Since 1959, we’ve been a leading source of long-term financing for economic, social, and institutional development in Latin America and the Caribbean. We do more than lending though. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Candidates must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

POSITION PURPOSE

This position will be within the Fixed Income Quantitative Investments and Research (FI Quant) Group. The primary role of the analyst will be to develop and enhance investment models in support of the Fixed Income group. The analyst will develop models and research in collaboration with the investment team with the objective of enhancing the investment performance. The analyst will engage the sell-side and academic research to keep current on topical research and apply these methods to enhance the proprietary capabilities.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Conduct quantitative research focusing on fixed Income emerging markets (local currency, hard currency and corporates) that is relevant and topical to supporting the fixed income investment team. Work with investment teams and other quantitative analysts to develop research agenda, execute on the research, and communicate the results.
Collaborate with investment teams and the front-office development team to conceptualize and build proprietary investment tools.
PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES / SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS

Required:
An undergraduate degree in computer science, physical sciences, engineering, mathematics, or financial engineering.
Comprehensive understanding of financial mathematics and portfolio concepts.
Ability to program in analytic languages (R, Python, etc.) and work with databases.
Detailed knowledge of fixed-income market and instruments.
Ability to work with numbers and datasets with full understanding of statistics and numerical analysis.
Highly self-motivated and detail-oriented.
Ability to communicate ideas effectively and solve problems creatively.
Preferred:
7+ years of prior work experience.
Knowledge of macroeconomics and its relation to the financial markets.
Experience researching EM FI markets.

Job Description:

Are you our Data Scientist that likes to perform research-level data analytics willing to work in Arlington, VA and at our customer sites in the National Capital Region to support ongoing and future programs to advance the state of the art in research and advanced machine learning and data fusion applications in the areas of mission-focused big data analytics and predictive analytics? You will be designing and optimizing a Data Science platform to advance national security objectives, produce and analyze results, disseminate findings, and contribute to publications and presentations with actionable intelligence insights. Exciting right!!

Fun stuff on the job you will do:
Work closely with software developers, network engineers, senior investigators, program managers, researchers, and data analysts on small teams to design and optimize a Data Science platform (DOMEX Data Discovery Platform – D3P) to produce and analyze results, disseminate findings, and contribute to publications and presentations.
Work on small projects analyzing a variety of big data covering national security, cyber security, business intelligence, online social media, human behavior and more.
Support multiple simultaneous projects and take open-ended or high-level guidance, independently and collaboratively make discoveries that are mission-relevant, and package and deliver the findings to a non-technical audience.
Have a mix of intellectual curiosity, quantitative acumen, and customer-focus to identify novel sources of data across a range of fields, to improve the performance of predictive algorithms, and to encourage user adoption of high-end data analytics platforms in partnership with a highly qualified, highly motivated team.
Have a strong background in research design, exploratory analysis, quantitative methods, user interface application design, and experience with customer outreach and engagement.
To be successful in this role you need the following:
B.S. Degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, or Computational Social Science; or Master’s degree or equivalent graduate degree including certificate-based advanced training courses;
8+ years of experience in data science, analytics or quantitative intelligence analysis, and demonstrating progressive technical development and outcomes. 6+ years of experience required with MS.
Must have an active TS clearance and must be able to achieve a TS/SCI clearance with Polygraph
Significant experience in one or more scripting languages such as R or Python
Proficient in one or more big data programming languages, such as Java or Python
Experience working with a hybrid team of analyst, engineers, and developers to conduct research, and build and deploy complex, but easy-to-use analytical platforms
Previous experience performing research in Data Analytics or big data
Track record of active learning and creative problem solving
Ability to analyze and assess software development or data acquisition requirements and determine optimum, cost-effective solutions
You will wow us even more if you have these skills:
A significant share of your data analytics experience in direct support if military or intelligence community customers, demonstrating progressive technical development and mission-focused outcomes
Significant experience dealing with open source, publicly available information (PAI) data sources and types
Significant experience performing quantitative analysis to support military or intelligence community operational activities
Previous experience developing predictive algorithms
Experience supporting cyber security or network security operations
Familiarity with social network analysis, supply chain analysis, forensic accounting, pattern of life, natural language processing, social media analysis, classification algorithms, and/or image processing
Experience blending analytical methodologies and leveraging existing COTS/GOTS/OS tools in unconventional manners
Familiarity utilizing virtualization and distributed field systems, such as Hadoop (or similar distributed file systems) in development and deployment environments
Familiarity using git, svn, JIRA, or other version control technologies
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS/C2S)
Familiarity with hardware platforms, e.g., CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, etc.

ABOUT US:

Embr Labs believes in harnessing the body’s natural response to temperature to enhance human wellbeing. We are a wellness tech company that has developed a unique, wearable thermal technology with therapeutic applications in both the consumer and regulated device sectors.

To date, Embr has sold over 65,000 devices to customers in 150 countries around the world. A mobile app and backend augment our hardware devices, forming a unique technology platform that combines thermal stimulation, digital interventions, and data to manage symptoms and treat disease. Our technology was invented by the company’s founders while at MIT; we are backed by DigiTx Partners, Safar Partners, Bose Ventures and Intel Capital, and we have partnered with companies like Johnson & Johnson.

‘EMBR’ stands for Environment, Mind, Body Resonance: we believe that technology can help us lead more balanced lives. Our workplace cultivates both fulfillment and fun. We are looking for an exceptional candidate to help us create a future where digital thermal interventions help people live better lives.

DESCRIPTION:

We seek a smart, energetic, and impact-oriented Senior Physiological Data Scientist. This is a strategic hire that will lead Embr Labs’ expansion into continuous physiological monitoring and real-time symptom detection.

Embr is now designing its next generation of innovative products where sensors and algorithms will be critical and offer a core competitive advantage. The Senior Physiological Data Scientist will lead a wide range of activities, from database design and machine learning to project management and technical leadership.

Collaborating with Embr’s senior technical leaders, and leading research collaborations, they will develop new technical capabilities for Embr Labs by taking early concepts all the way to productizable prototypes. For the first two years, the Senior Physiological Data Scientist will also hold a Visiting Scientist position with the Department of Kinesiology and Institute for Applied Life Sciences at the University of Massachusetts Amherst (UMass IALS).

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide technical leadership for sensor data-related research and development at Embr Labs
Oversee the development of new technical capabilities that utilize physiological monitoring
Develop R&D data infrastructure to transfer and store physiological data streams, including data pipelines and databases
Train, refine, and evaluate algorithms that identify symptoms and other physiological markers from sensor data
Collaborate with researchers and engineers to translate algorithms into low-latency embedded systems on actual prototype devices, and in the translation of successful prototype devices into actual commercial products
Ensure that physiological data projects are executed on schedule and on budget, and that collaborations with academic & industry partners are smooth and efficient.
IDEAL CANDIDATES WILL HAVE:
Deep technical expertise in biomedical informatics, data science, or biomedical engineering (Ph.D. or equivalent industry experience).
Experience working with physiological data from wearables or body sensors.
Proficiency in machine learning and deep learning for human physiology data.
Successful track record of taking algorithms from conception to implementation on products.
A self-starter personality and the ability to work with broad direction and little oversight.
Proficient in Python, Matlab, or R; Git; and SQL.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Experience with relational and/or NoSQL database technologies, streaming data processing and data lakes is a plus.
THINGS YOU WILL GET:
A full-time position at Embr Labs, combined with a two-year Visiting Scientist position at UMass Amherst Department of Kinesiology & Institute for Applied Life Sciences.
The opportunity to make a transformative impact at a rapidly growing wellness tech startup company.
Constant exposure to interesting science and novel technology.
Ability to build relationships with other technology leaders in the emerging Digital Therapeutics ecosystem
A strong leadership team that encourages close collaboration; talented, open-minded team of contributing engineers.
A dynamic, exciting workplace with a flexible work environment
A caring team that values mutual respect and includes three MIT co-founders, one of the top female CEOs in the Boston tech scene, bright and thoughtful employees, and a small dog.
Competitive compensation, benefits, and equity in a fast-growing startup.
LOCATION:

This position is based at UMass in Amherst, Massachusetts for the first two years. Following the completion of the project with UMass IALS, the Senior Physiological Data Scientist will be given the opportunity to work from the Embr Labs office in Boston or to keep working remotely from Amherst.

Senior Analyst, Brand Houses

What makes this a great opportunity?

Opportunity to join a dynamic team and support our Global Brand Houses in the development of the financial foundations of their long term strategies to deliver increasing profitability & value for the business. The role is a fantastic opportunity to gain valuable finance experience in a fast-paced environment. This role also presents a strong entry point to the company, and can be a stepping stone to future opportunities across the organization.

Role Responsibilities

DECISION SUPPORT:

Help Brand House leadership make key financial decisions with supporting quantitative analysis that drives long-term premiumization strategy for the brand house i.e. Model brand P&Ls to drive recommendations around brand growth levers while tying in understanding of balance sheet to optimize ROIC
Support financial performance through high quality decision support and FP&A including overall P&L, sales and margin management, free cash flow and ROIC
Support ad hoc requirements from the Brand House teams in pursuit of near-term deliverables and long-term goal

BRAND HOUSE REPORTING:

Support monthly and quarterly reporting packages and associated presentations, providing Brand House analytics as requested
Prepare internal reporting and analysis of financial results / PBMC performance for Brand House leadership (+allocations where applicable)
Drive continual improvement of reporting and processes with the goal of driving consistent, timely, and value-added analysis

INVESTMENT:

Consolidate markets global demand and review future liquid lay down plan with strategy team, operations and supply chain given brand strategic pillars, ROIC analysis & demand trends
Work with operations to review ROIC analysis per brand family
Analyze Marketing investment and provide recommendations on opportunities to improve efficiency of spend

INNOVATION:

Market monitoring is responsible for protecting both consumers and market participants by identifying and reporting market design issues, market manipulation, and evaluating market performance. In fulfilling this role, we rely on a multidisciplinary team with expertise in economics, financial analysis, engineering, data science and law.


How You Will Make an Impact

Routine monitoring of market outcomes and participant behavior, and performing in-depth empirical analysis of market performance and efficiency. Apply economic principles to practical and challenging electricity market issues. Work with large and complex data, and develop a detailed understanding of wholesale electricity market mechanics and the interactions between markets.

• Market Surveillance

• Continuously track market outcomes, identify and explain trends and outliers

• Design, develop and run screening tools to identify market performance issues, non-compliance with market rules and uncompetitive behavior

• Identify and source relevant data through research and proactive engagement with colleagues

• Build data queries and analysis in a programming language

• Economic Analysis

• Scope and perform empirical analysis of market performance, market efficiency and behavior

• Evaluate current and new market rules changes and recommend enhancements

• Reporting

• Present complex and technical content to a diverse audience through written reports and presentations

• Write clear and insightful content, collaborate with colleagues to make connections between report sections

• Investigations

• Identify market outcomes and market participant behavior that warrants further investigation and analysis

• Conduct investigations and make referrals to the federal energy regulator


What We Are Looking For

• Master’s Degree in Economics or Finance.

• Strong quantitative skills with emphasis on analysis using SAS or similar programming language.

• Experience working with very large and complex data sets desirable.

• Ability to conduct forensic-like investigations of market outcomes and participant behavior.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas, in plain language, at an executive, board member or regulator level.

• Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.

• Ability to change direction quickly in response to changing information, priorities, policies, rules or the results of an analysis.

• Proactively seek clarification of requirements and direction; take responsibility when needed.

The position is open to qualified candidates at various levels, ranging from Associate to Senior Analyst. The level depends on a number of considerations, including, but not limited to:
• experience in a similar role

• technical proficiency

• academic background

• ability to manage and lead projects

• ability to mentor analysts, and

• level of communication and interpersonal skills.

ISO New England oversees the 24/7 operation of the power grid that covers the six-states of New England and administers the region’s $10+ billion “stock exchange” for the buying and selling of wholesale electricity. The power system is constantly evolving as new technologies emerge and energy policies evolve. There is a lot going on at our organization behind the scenes to make sure the grid continuously yields reliable electricity at competitive prices while addressing the unique challenges that come along with our industry.

What We Offer: ISO New England is located in Holyoke, MA. The company provides a base salary plus bonus, competitive Medical and Dental plan, paid vacation, 401k with company match, retirement plan and more. All benefits start on your first day.

Equal Opportunity
